page.title: 18Changing Times - 1965
page.content: Fochriw was the same size in 1965 as it is today.There were more children going to school.There was no Nursery or Community Centre.The Cae Glas Estate was still standing.By now most houses had hot and cold water, electric, power for lighting and cooking and gas on the new estate.Some houses had central heating because people could afford it.People had more money and leisure time.The men worked in the pits and factories.The women worked in the factories.There were as many women employed as men.The bus service was good but the railways were declining. People had cars.Private buses took people on holiday or days out.Rugby supporters flew to France and Ireland. Some people could now afford to take holidays abroad.
